title: 2016 Splash, How many of you...
body:

Am i just a doofus :(

I thought it was a hint on upcomeing Aatrox buffs, as it's not very feasible that any teamcomp would have an Aatrox right now...
but with shy, it makes perfect sence, top Yasuo, mid Oriana, but braum+cait and jungle shy, haveing shy as ball-delivery and the yasuo ult to add some more wombo to the ori ult combo...
And noticed how Yasuo is holding the sword on the wrong side?

{{champion:157}} Oh, there's something I ought to tell you.
{{champion:92}} Tell me.
{{champion:157}} I'm not left-handed either.
Normally I'd say it's the mirror image thing, like with Gnar's monocle and such, but that's definitely his left arm grabbing his sword since that's the armor plating he has on his left arm.
I don't know if it's right to call Gnar's monocle thing mirrored since the splash has his tooth on the opposite side of his face as the monocle but in-game they're on the same side.

I actually thought it was Super Mega Death Rocket, jokes on me.
I thought Shyvana was Aatrox.
What the hell is up with Shyvana

She's supposed to be mid-transformation. Happens so fast normally you wouldn't think about it, but really try and picture it in your head. Seeing a human-ish looking female explode into a dragon would not be a pretty sight.
Even so, that wing anatomy is way off; fingers do not sprout from our elbows.
It's a wyvern, not a dragon. A wyvern is a dragon that has 2 wings ,that act like arms and wings, and 2 legs. Dragons have 2 wings and 4 legs.

https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/3/3b/Paris_Tuileries_Garden_Facepalm_statue.jpg

I am not discussing whether or not she is a dragon, as a wyvern is a subtype of dragon being a reptilian creature with wings. I am pointing out her wings have improper anatomy, as the fingers which form the framework are growing from her _**elbow**_.

Observe proper wing anatomy:
http://orig09.deviantart.net/63f8/f/2009/132/f/8/dragon_wing_and_chest_anatomy_by_ashere.jpg

I love the Internet. Where else would we find a wyvern's wing anatomy?

Though her transformation is really weird looking.

In all honesty, even if there were no anatomical studies of a wyvern's wings, most draw inspiration from common bats, which act as a serviceable substitute and basis.

Just look at Renaissance artists who didn't use bats as a reference point.

https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/1/1c/Vittore_carpaccio,_san_giorgio_e_il_drago_01.jpg
